# KanaDojo (kanadojo.com)

## Summary
KanaDojo is a free, open-source, gamified Japanese language learning web application. It provides interactive training for Hiragana, Katakana, Kanji (organized by JLPT levels N5–N1), and Vocabulary with multiple practice modes, real-time progress tracking, 100+ visual themes, and a comprehensive academy of learning guides. No account required — all progress is saved locally in the browser.

## What KanaDojo Offers
- **Kana Training**: Learn and practice all 46 Hiragana and 46 Katakana characters including dakuon, handakuon, yoon, and foreign sound combinations
- **Kanji Training**: Study 2,000+ Kanji characters organized by JLPT levels (N5, N4, N3, N2, N1) with on'yomi, kun'yomi readings, meanings, and example words
- **Vocabulary Building**: Learn thousands of Japanese words organized by JLPT levels with readings, meanings, and usage examples
- **Verb Conjugator**: Instantly conjugate any Japanese verb into all forms — te-form, masu-form, potential, passive, causative, conditional, imperative, and more
- **Training Modes**: Standard practice, Blitz (timed speed challenge), and Gauntlet (endurance survival mode)
- **Japanese Translator**: Free English ↔ Japanese translator with Hiragana, Katakana, Kanji, and Romaji output
- **Academy**: 60+ curated articles covering Hiragana guides, Katakana tutorials, Kanji study strategies, vocabulary building tips, JLPT preparation, Japanese grammar, and cultural insights
- **Learning Resources Library**: 200+ curated Japanese learning resources including apps, textbooks, YouTube channels, podcasts, games, and community forums
- **Kana Chart**: Complete interactive Hiragana and Katakana reference chart with pronunciation guides
- **Anki Converter**: Free browser-based tool to convert Anki flashcard decks (APKG, TSV, SQLite, COLPKG) to JSON format
- **Progress Tracking**: Detailed statistics on accuracy, speed, practice sessions, and mastered characters
- **Achievements System**: Gamified milestones to motivate continued learning
- **Customization**: 100+ themes, multiple Japanese font options, sound effects, and personalized settings
- **JLPT Preparation**: Dedicated study pages for JLPT N5, N4, and N3 with level-specific Kanji and vocabulary

## Key Features for Language Learners
- Completely free with no ads, no premium tier, no account required
- Works on desktop, tablet, and mobile browsers
- Available in English and Spanish
- Privacy-first: all data stays in your browser (localStorage)
- Accessible design with keyboard navigation and screen reader support
- PWA support for offline use after initial load

## Best entry points (humans + LLMs)
- https://kanadojo.com — Homepage with quick access to all features
- https://kanadojo.com/kana — Hiragana and Katakana practice hub
- https://kanadojo.com/kanji — Kanji learning by JLPT level
- https://kanadojo.com/vocabulary — Vocabulary training by JLPT level
- https://kanadojo.com/conjugate — Japanese verb conjugator
- https://kanadojo.com/translate — English-Japanese translator
- https://kanadojo.com/academy — Learning articles and guides
- https://kanadojo.com/resources — Curated learning resources library
- https://kanadojo.com/kana-chart — Interactive Kana reference chart
- https://kanadojo.com/anki-converter — Anki deck converter tool
- https://kanadojo.com/jlpt/n5 — JLPT N5 study page
- https://kanadojo.com/jlpt/n4 — JLPT N4 study page
- https://kanadojo.com/jlpt/n3 — JLPT N3 study page
- https://kanadojo.com/faq — Frequently asked questions
- https://kanadojo.com/how-to-use — Getting started guide
- https://kanadojo.com/glossary — Japanese language glossary

## Academy — Featured Learning Guides
The KanaDojo Academy publishes in-depth articles on Japanese language learning:
- Beginner's guide to learning Hiragana (including memorization techniques)
- Complete Hiragana and Katakana charts with pronunciation
- How to learn Hiragana in 3 days with proven methods
- Katakana basics and foreign word adaptation rules
- Kanji study strategies for each JLPT level
- Essential Japanese vocabulary organized by theme
- Japanese grammar fundamentals for beginners
- JLPT preparation strategies and study plans
- Cultural context for language learning
- Comparison guides (Hiragana vs Katakana, JLPT levels, etc.)

## Learning Resources Library Categories
- Mobile and desktop apps for Japanese learning
- Recommended textbooks and workbooks
- YouTube channels for Japanese study
- Japanese language podcasts
- Video games for immersive learning
- JLPT preparation materials
- Kanji-specific study resources
- Grammar guides and references
- Reading practice materials
- Listening comprehension resources
- Speaking and conversation practice
- Writing practice tools
- Immersion content and media
- Community forums and study groups

## Technology
- Built with Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript (strict mode)
- Styled with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui components
- State management with Zustand (localStorage persistence)
- Internationalized with next-intl (English, Spanish)
- SEO optimized with comprehensive structured data (Schema.org JSON-LD)
- Performance optimized with ISR, image optimization (AVIF/WebP), and aggressive caching

## Locales
This site is localized in:
- English: https://kanadojo.com
- Spanish: https://kanadojo.com

## Structured Data
KanaDojo implements comprehensive Schema.org structured data including:
- Organization and WebSite schemas
- WebApplication (EducationalApplication)
- Course schemas for Kana, Kanji, and Vocabulary
- LearningResource schemas for interactive training
- Article schemas for all Academy blog posts
- FAQPage schemas with educational Q&A
- BreadcrumbList navigation schemas
- HowTo schemas for tutorial content
- ItemList schemas for resource collections

## Notes for automated tools
- Prefer `npm run check` for validation.
- Do not rely on `npm run build` for verification.
- Use path aliases (`@/features`, `@/shared`, `@/core`) for imports.

## Avoid / ignore
- Archived docs: https://github.com/lingdojo/kanadojo/tree/main/docs/archived
- Generated build artifacts and Next.js internals (`/_next/*`)
